articles.title: Apple Stock Hasn’t Had a Streak Like This Since 2010. What It Means as Value Nears $4 Trillion.
articles.content: Apple  is on the cusp of an artificial-intelligence-fueled “golden era of growth,” Wedbush analysts argued Thursday as they raised their price target on shares of the tech giant.  Wedbush analyst Dan Ives increased his price target to $325, a Wall Street high, and maintained an Outperform rating, just days after reiterating a $300 price target on the stock.  Analysts surveyed by FactSet have an average price target of $248.14 on Apple shares.

articles.title: Apple's price target bumped to $325 by Wedbush
articles.content: Wedbush Securities is growing increasingly bullish on Apple (AAPL), with analyst Dan Ives raising the company's price target from $300 to $325. The upgrade comes as Apple approaches a $4 trillion market capitalization, and Ives cites the upcoming iPhone 16 cycle as the catalyst for what he calls a "new golden era" for the tech giant. Catalysts anchors Brad Smith and Brian Sozzi break down the details. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Catalysts here. This post was written by Angel Smith

articles.title: Apple Stock to Hit $325, Wedbush Securities Cites "Golden Era of Growth"
articles.content: Apple on Track for $4 Trillion Market Cap as Wedbush Sets $325 Target

articles.title: Apple Stock Hits All-Time High Thursday as Analyst Sees 'Golden Era of Growth' With AI
articles.content: Apple shares closed at an all-time high Thursday after Wedbush analysts raised their price target for the stock, telling clients they expect the iPhone maker could be headed for a "golden era of growth" driven by demand for artificial intelligence.
